pullRequest.body:
Given a functor `F : C â¥¤ D`, we define the left Kan extension functor `F.lan : (C â¥¤ E) â¥¤ (D â¥¤ E)` which sends a functor `G : C â¥¤ E` to its left Kan extension along `F`. (This is a step towards the refactor of `Lan/Ran` in mathlib using the new API for Kan extensions of functors #10425.)

---

nodes.body: Thanks @dagurtomas for the suggestion. It was indeed very confusing... Now, we extend `F : C â¥¤ H` along `L : C â¥¤ D`. I use the category `H` because `E` is sometimes used for terms in `LeftExtension L F`. (Doing so, the notations will be more consistent with the future API for derived functors, where `L` shall be a localization functor.)

Thanks!

Could you make the variable names throughout the folder `Functor/KanExtension`Â more consistent? For example, always use `L: C â¥¤ D` for the "along" functor and `F : C â¥¤ E` for the "of" functor (or whatever). It's a bit confusing that `F`Â becomes the "along" functor in the adjunction file when it was the "of" functor in the basic file, and also the categories changed names.
Thanks! LGTM

Thanks so much! 1 minor request.

bors d+

```suggestion

@[simp]
lemma lanAdjunction_counit_app (G : D â¥¤ E) : (F.lanAdjunction E).counit.app G = 
    descOfIsLeftKanExtension (F.lan.obj (F â‹™ G)) (F.lanUnit.app (F â‹™ G)) G (ðŸ™ (F â‹™ G)) := rfl
```
I don't know if this is necessary but it seems desirable to have access to the API lemmas for `descOfIsLeftKanExtension`Â when working with the counit

Thanks for the suggestion. I have added this lemma, but not as a `simp` lemma in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12168/commits/1ce90141d041fc31386752eb402e52dbbe7a2a0b where I also obtained the lemma
```lean
lemma isIso_lanAdjunction_counit_app_iff (G : D â¥¤ E) :
    IsIso ((F.lanAdjunction E).counit.app G) â†” G.IsLeftKanExtension (ðŸ™ (F â‹™ G)) :=
```
Here I feel that it is better if the LHS is not further simplified.
Can you please add 1 or 2 sentences explaining what this refactor should be doing?
Thanks for the suggestion. I have added more details.

source.title: feat/refactor: redefinition of homology + derived categories

nodes.body: Could you make the variable names throughout the folder `Functor/KanExtension`Â more consistent? For example, always use `L: C â¥¤ D` for the "along" functor and `F : C â¥¤ E` for the "of" functor (or whatever). It's a bit confusing that `F`Â becomes the "along" functor in the adjunction file when it was the "of" functor in the basic file, and also the categories changed names.

Thanks @dagurtomas for the suggestion. It was indeed very confusing... Now, we extend `F : C â¥¤ H` along `L : C â¥¤ D`. I use the category `H` because `E` is sometimes used for terms in `LeftExtension L F`. (Doing so, the notations will be more consistent with the future API for derived functors, where `L` shall be a localization functor.)
Thanks! LGTM
